Manpreet,

I can help shed some light on the delays since last Thursday.

Some customers were patched beginning on Friday of last week, and soon after that, Netwrix started receiving reports that some systems ceased to process certain logged events. Netwrix confirmed the behavior and began working on a fix. As a precaution, Netwrix temporarily paused the distribution of the hotfix (on the 2nd of July) until a replacement was available.

As of this morning, A revised hotfix for CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix versions 5.6.0.0 through 5.9.3.0, labeled Hotfix 1.1, was released. This hotfix addresses and supersedes the prior hotfix and resolves the event processing issue.

So with that said, we didn't have an acceptable hotfix to be pushed to your environment until today.

Can you please confirm that is it OK for our team to push the hotfix to the production server ASAP? They are currently working on pushing the hotfix to the staging server, but I would like to be 100% sure that it is okay for them to push to the production server. If it is OK, I will send in the request and update you as soon as it is pushed.

As for your second question, regarding the currently deployed agents...

While the server hotfix is the most critical to apply, we advise customers to act with urgency in updating their agents, while following an expedited testing and emergency change control process. CVE-2024-36073, CVE-2024-36074, and CVE-2024-36075 affect the agents, and may permit an attacker to escalate privileges on an affected endpoint or bypass DLP policies. While the scope of impact is limited to each endpoint, an attacker may be able to utilize them as part of a chain to cause greater damage.

I can help shed some light on the delays since last Thursday. 



 



Some customers were patched beginning on Friday of last week, and soon after that, Netwrix started receiving reports that some systems ceased to process certain logged events. Netwrix confirmed the behavior and began working on a fix. As a precaution, Netwrix temporarily paused the distribution of the hotfix (on the 2nd of July) until a replacement was available.



 



As of this morning, A revised hotfix for CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix versions 5.6.0.0 through 5.9.3.0, labeled Hotfix 1.1, was released. This hotfix addresses and supersedes the prior hotfix and resolves the event processing issue.

While the server hotfix is the most critical to apply, we advise customers to act with urgency in updating their agents, while following an expedited testing and emergency change control process. While the scope of impact is limited to each endpoint, an attacker may be able to utilize them as part of a chain to cause greater damage.
